title: Bug 10403 - Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
description: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted then rebuilt. Some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
OB: Currently, when a user creates a project and sets the output folder to a bin directory, the system does not check if the bin directory can be deleted and rebuilt.
EB: After creating a project and setting the output folder to a bin directory, the system should confirm if the bin directory can be scrubbed (deleted) and then rebuilt.
SR:
To reproduce this issue:
1. Open the project creation interface.
2. Specify an existing directory structure for the project.
3. Set the output folder to a bin directory.
4. Click on the 'Create Project' button.
5. Observe that there is no confirmation or check to verify if the bin directory can be deleted and rebuilt.
